cve.description: Summary: A vulnerability in the Linux kernel's BPF subsystem was identified and resolved, specifically addressing a panic in the ktls sockmap functionality. The issue arises when the BPF program modifies the size of msg_pl->sg during execution, potentially causing inconsistencies in msg_iter during rollback operations. This can lead to kernel crashes due to exceeding the actual size of msg_iter. Impact: Exploitation of this vulnerability could result in kernel crashes, leading to potential denial of service conditions. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerability is associated with the handling of cork_bytes and non-zero copy logic in the BPF subsystem. Incorrect rollback operations during data processing could lead to inconsistencies and kernel instability. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]
cve.title: CVE-2025-38166

vulnerability.description: Summary: A vulnerability in the Linux kernel's BPF subsystem was identified and resolved, specifically addressing a panic in the ktls sockmap functionality. The issue arises when the BPF program modifies the size of msg_pl->sg during execution, potentially causing inconsistencies in msg_iter during rollback operations. This can lead to kernel crashes due to exceeding the actual size of msg_iter. Impact: Exploitation of this vulnerability could result in kernel crashes, leading to potential denial of service conditions. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerability is associated with the handling of cork_bytes and non-zero copy logic in the BPF subsystem. Incorrect rollback operations during data processing could lead to inconsistencies and kernel instability. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]

resolved","status":{"code":"Unhealthy"},"additionalData":{"subAssessmentsLink":"/subscriptions/5abcdef6-1234-5678-8912-e1234abcdef1/resourcegroups/example-test_group/providers/microsoft.containerservice/managedclusters/example-test/securityentitydata/namespace-kube-system-pod-metrics-server-*-*-container-metrics-server/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/c2345673-abcd-0012-abcd-81234554321d/subAssessments","maxCvss30Score":"7.6","subAssessment":{"type":"Microsoft.Security/assessments/subAssessments","id":"/subscriptions/5abcdef6-1234-5678-8912-e1234abcdef1/resourcegroups/example-test_group/providers/microsoft.containerservice/managedclusters/example-test/securityentitydata/namespace-kube-system-pod-metrics-server-*-*-container-metrics-server/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/c2345673-abcd-0012-abcd-81234554321d/subassessments/6789789b-abcd-790a-1234-babcdefabcd4","name":"6789789b-abcd-790a-1234-babcdefabcd4","properties":{"id":"CVE-2024-33600","displayName":"CVE-2024-33600","status":{"code":"Unhealthy","severity":"Medium"},"remediation":"This vulnerability is patchable by a version update","category":"","description":"Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in the GNU C Library (glibc) and its Name Service Cache Daemon (nscd). These include null pointer dereferences (CVE-2024-33600, CVE-2024-33601), stack-based buffer overflows (CVE-2024-33599), and improper memory allocation handling (CVE-2024-33602). These flaws can lead to denial of service conditions, potentially crashing the system. The vulnerabilities affect various components and versions of glibc, including its use in Oracle Communications products. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in denial of service, unauthorized access to sensitive data, and potential system crashes, impacting confidentiality, integrity, and availability. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerabilities are present in glibc versions prior to 2.35-7 and 2.38-11. They affect the nscd binary and are associated with netgroup cache handling. CVSS scores for related Oracle Communications products are rated at 8.6, indicating high severity. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by references.title: Amazon Linux 2 2017.12 - ALAS2-2024-2718: medium priority package update for glibc

sub_assessment.description: Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in the GNU C Library (glibc) and its Name Service Cache Daemon (nscd). These include null pointer dereferences (CVE-2024-33600, CVE-2024-33601), stack-based buffer overflows (CVE-2024-33599), and improper memory allocation handling (CVE-2024-33602). These flaws can lead to denial of service conditions, potentially crashing the system. The vulnerabilities affect various components and versions of glibc, including its use in Oracle Communications products. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in denial of service, unauthorized access to sensitive data, and potential system crashes, impacting confidentiality, integrity, and availability. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerabilities are present in glibc versions prior to 2.35-7 and 2.38-11. They affect the nscd binary and are associated with netgroup cache handling. CVSS scores for related Oracle Communications products are rated at 8.6, indicating high severity. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]
sub_assessment.name: 6789789b-abcd-790a-1234-babcdefabcd4
sub_assessment.remediation: This vulnerability is patchable by a version update

The vulnerabilities affect various components and versions of glibc, including its use in Oracle Communications products. sub_assessment.description: Summary: CVE-2025-22868 describes a vulnerability in the Golang package 'golang.org/x/oauth2/jws' where an attacker can exploit the token parsing mechanism by providing a malformed token, leading to unexpected memory consumption. This flaw can result in a denial of service condition. Impact: Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to denial of service, potentially disrupting services relying on the affected package. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerability is specific to the 'golang.org/x/oauth2/jws' package and involves token parsing mechanisms. It is referenced in multiple advisories and affects specific versions of the package. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]

Linux","timeGenerated":"2025-08-21T17:40:43.325407Z","resourceDetails":{"source":"Azure","id":"/subscriptions/5abcdef6-1234-5678-8912-e1234abcdef1/resourceGroups/DEFENDER_CLOUD_GROUP/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm-for-defender-cloud-test"},"additionalData":{"assessedResourceType":"ServerVulnerabilityTvm","cve":[{"title":"CVE-2025-6021","cvssScore":7.5,"cvssVersion":3,"severity":"High","description":"Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in the libxml2 library, a development toolbox for XML standards. These include an integer overflow in the xmlBuildQName function (CVE-2025-6021), leading to a stack-based buffer overflow, memory corruption, or denial of service when processing crafted input. Other issues include out-of-bounds read (CVE-2025-32414), heap use-after-free (CVE-2025-49794), and type confusion (CVE-2025-49796), all potentially resulting in denial of service. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could lead to memory corruption, application crashes, or denial of service, impacting system stability and security. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerabilities affect libxml2 versions less than 2.10.4-8 and 2.11.5-6. For detailed information, refer to the respective CVE pages. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. These include CVE-2025-49794, a heap use-after-free issue leading to potential denial of service; CVE-2025-49796, a type confusion flaw causing denial of service; and CVE-2025-6021, an integer overflow in xmlBuildQName() resulting in a stack buffer overflow. Additionally, processing certain sch:name elements in XML files can trigger memory corruption, potentially causing crashes or undefined behavior. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could lead to denial of service, application crashes, or undefined behavior due to memory corruption, potentially exposing sensitive data. AdditionalInformation: Conflicting information exists regarding the affected versions of libxml2 for CVE-2025-49796, with reports indicating versions less than 2.10.4-8 and 2.11.5-6 are vulnerable. This flaw arises from improper input size validation when processing overly long commands, leading to a stack buffer overflow. Exploitation of this issue could result in program crashes and, under specific configurations lacking modern protections, may allow execution of malicious code. Impact: Exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to denial of service through application crashes and, in rare cases, execution of arbitrary code, posing a significant security risk. AdditionalInformation: There is a discrepancy in the affected versions of libxml2, with reports indicating versions less than 2.10.4-8 and less than 2.11.5-6 are vulnerable. cve_list.description: Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in the libxml2 library, a development toolbox for XML standards. These include an integer overflow in the xmlBuildQName function (CVE-2025-6021), leading to a stack-based buffer overflow, memory corruption, or denial of service when processing crafted input. Other issues include out-of-bounds read (CVE-2025-32414), heap use-after-free (CVE-2025-49794), and type confusion (CVE-2025-49796), all potentially resulting in denial of service. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could lead to memory corruption, application crashes, or denial of service, impacting system stability and security. AdditionalInformation: The vulnerabilities affect libxml2 versions less than 2.10.4-8 and 2.11.5-6. For detailed information, refer to the respective CVE pages. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]
cve_list.title: CVE-2025-6021

cve_list.description: Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in the libxml2 library, which implements various XML standards. These include CVE-2025-49794, a heap use-after-free issue leading to potential denial of service; CVE-2025-49796, a type confusion flaw causing denial of service; and CVE-2025-6021, an integer overflow in xmlBuildQName() resulting in a stack buffer overflow. Additionally, processing certain sch:name elements in XML files can trigger memory corruption, potentially causing crashes or undefined behavior. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could lead to denial of service, application crashes, or undefined behavior due to memory corruption, potentially exposing sensitive data. AdditionalInformation: Conflicting information exists regarding the affected versions of libxml2 for CVE-2025-49796, with reports indicating versions less than 2.10.4-8 and 2.11.5-6 are vulnerable. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]
cve_list.title: CVE-2025-49796

cve_list.description: Summary: A vulnerability identified as CVE-2025-6170 exists in the interactive shell of the xmllint command-line tool, part of the libxml2 package. This flaw arises from improper input size validation when processing overly long commands, leading to a stack buffer overflow. Exploitation of this issue could result in program crashes and, under specific configurations lacking modern protections, may allow execution of malicious code. Impact: Exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to denial of service through application crashes and, in rare cases, execution of arbitrary code, posing a significant security risk. AdditionalInformation: There is a discrepancy in the affected versions of libxml2, with reports indicating versions less than 2.10.4-8 and less than 2.11.5-6 are vulnerable. Security administrators should verify the correct affected version range. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]
cve_list.title: CVE-2025-6170

cve_list.description: Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in the libxml2 library, a development toolbox for XML standards. These include a use-after-free issue (CVE-2025-49794) occurring during XPath element parsing under specific XML schematron conditions, potentially leading to program crashes or undefined behaviors. Additionally, type confusion (CVE-2025-49796) and an integer overflow in xmlBuildQName() (CVE-2025-6021) have been reported, which could result in denial of service or stack buffer overflow. Impact: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could lead to denial of service, application crashes, or other undefined behaviors, compromising system stability and security. AdditionalInformation: Conflicting information exists regarding the affected versions of libxml2 for CVE-2025-49794, with reports indicating versions less than 2.10.4-8 and 2.11.5-6. Security administrators should verify the specific version details. Remediation: Apply the latest patches and updates provided by the respective vendors. [Generated by AI]
cve_list.title: CVE-2025-49794
